dublin_core.dcvalue: A gaming platform has been used to implement a Home Automated Telemanagement HAT system for chronic disease management in the patient s home The system questions patients with congestive heart failure CHF to monitor symptoms weight changes and quality of life while educating the patient on their disease The system is designed to run on the Nintendo Wii videogame console using an active internet connection and the console s built in internet browser It questions the patient daily on their condition monitors their weight and provides the patient with instant feedback on their condition in the form of a 3 zone CHF action plan The system is designed to be as simple as possible making it usable by patients with no prior computer or videogame experience This telemanagement system has been successfully designed and implemented to optimize the care of patients with CHF
